pci_project_new_payment_method_save_expl: To create a project, you must first confirm your identity by adding a payment method. This allows us to better protect our community from spammers and bots.
If you do not use OVHcloud solutions, you will not have to pay any fees.
pci_project_new_payment_method_add_expla: You need to register a payment method to validate your identity.  You will not be debited and nothing will be withdrawn until you consume resources.
pci_project_new_payment_method_add_info_: By clicking ‘PayPal’, you will be redirected to the PayPal secure interface to register your account.
By clicking ‘Add’, you will be redirected to the ”My payment methods section of the OVHcloud Control Panel.
pci_project_new_payment_method_add_credi: No direct debit will be charged to your credit card.
A temporary fingerprint is made at the next step to confirm the validity of your card.
pci_project_new_payment_method_add_warni: If you select PayPal, a transaction of {{amount}} will be made on your account to confirm that it works properly. This credit is not lost. It will be used to pay for the first resources you deploy.

Your payment card will be validated between 24 and 48 hours after we have received your direct debit authorisation, which needs to be sent by post. After it has been validated, you can create a Public Cloud project.
pci_project_new_payment_method_add_info_: By signing a direct debit mandate, you authorise OVH S.A.S to register this payment method as a default payment method for future orders. When your services reach their expiry dates, this payment method will automatically be used to pay for your services with automatic renewal and pay-as-you-go billing. You can add, delete or modify payment methods at any time via the OVHcloud Control Panel.

You will be redirected to a space where you can register your bank account and electronically sign your direct debit mandate.{{break}} You can then use this payment method to complete your order.{{break}} Warning — the owner of the bank account must be the same as the owner of the OVHcloud account.

The data collected is processed by OVHcloud as a data controller in order to set up your SEPA direct debit.{{break}}Setting up a SEPA direct debit requires a mandate that you will be asked to sign electronically using a solution provided by Worldline, a provider authorised to deliver the trusted services defined by the ‘eDIAS’ Regulation n° 910/2014 of 23 July 2014. In this context, the data is sent to Worldline.
By clicking "Add", you will be redirected to the ‘My payment methods’ section of the OVHcloud Control Panel.
pci_project_new_payment_method_add_warni: Your payment card will be validated between 24 and 48 hours after we have received your direct debit authorisation, which needs to be sent by post. After it has been validated, you can create a Public Cloud project.
pci_project_new_payment_method_add_credi: The transaction to register your card will be processed by OVH S.A.S.
